verses.verse: Cast<WH7971> your bread<WH3899> on<WH6440> the waters;<WH4325> for you shall find<WH4672> it after many<WH7230> days.<WH3117>
Give<WH5414> a portion<WH2506> to seven,<WH7651> yes,<WH8083> even to eight; for you don't<WH3045> know what evil<WH7451> will be on the earth.<WH776>

If the clouds<WH5645> are full<WH4390> of rain,<WH1653> they empty<WH7324> themselves on the earth;<WH776> and if a tree<WH6086> falls<WH5307> toward the south,<WH1864> or toward the north,<WH6828> in the place<WH4725> where the tree<WH6086> falls,<WH5307> there shall it be.<WH1933>
He who observes<WH8104> the wind<WH7307> won't<WH2232> sow; and he who regards<WH7200> the clouds<WH5645> won't<WH7114> reap.

As you don't<WH3045> know what is the way<WH1870> of the wind,<WH7307> nor how the bones<WH6106> grow in the womb<WH990> of her who is with child;<WH4392> even so you don't<WH3045> know the work<WH4639> of God<WH430> who does all.<WH6213>

In the morning<WH1242> sow<WH2232> your seed,<WH2233> and in the evening<WH6153> don't<WH3240> withhold your hand;<WH3027> for you don't<WH3045> know which<WH335> will prosper,<WH3787> whether this or that,<WH8147> or whether they both will be equally<WH259> good.<WH2896>
Truly the light<WH216> is sweet,<WH4966> and a pleasant<WH2896> thing it is for the eyes<WH5869> to see<WH7200> the sun.<WH8121>

Yes,<WH120> if a man lives<WH2421> many<WH7235> years,<WH8141> let him rejoice<WH8055> in them all;<WH2142> but let him remember the days<WH3117> of darkness,<WH2822> for they shall be many.<WH7235> All that comes<WH935> is vanity.<WH1892>

Rejoice,<WH8055> young man,<WH970> in your youth,<WH3208> and let your heart<WH3820> cheer<WH2895> you in the days<WH3117> of your youth,<WH979> and walk<WH1980> in the ways<WH1870> of your heart,<WH3820> and in the sight<WH4758> of your eyes;<WH4758> but know<WH3045> that for all these things God<WH430> will bring<WH935> you into judgment.<WH4941>
Therefore remove<WH5493> sorrow<WH3708> from your heart,<WH3820> and put away<WH5674> evil<WH7451> from your flesh;<WH1320> for youth<WH7839> and the dawn<WH7839> of life are vanity.<WH1892>
